line_1: Thus sportive boys, around some bason's brim,
line_2: Behold the pipe-drawn bladders circling swim;

line_1: Oft in wide lakes, around their warmer brim
line_2: In hollow pyramids the crystals swim;

line_1: A pond before full to the brim,
line_2: Where cows may cool, and geese may swim,

line_1: To sip flat pleasures from thy glass's brim,
line_2: And waste the precious hour that's due to him.

line_1: While the scum, as 'tis call'd, rises up to the brim;
line_2: But be sure that the syrup you carefully skim,

line_2: I left this milk-pan yet to skim,
